for its heat and for its electrons the heat is mainly transported by phonons

before scattering but the electrons travel 10 nanometers before scattering and so there's a huge discrepancy in
length scales 300 nanometers for the heat 10 nanometers for the electrons and if you can create defects that are on a
length scale somewhere in between you can force the phonons to scatter off those defects at a higher rate and lower
the thermal conductivity whereas the electrons because they're scattering every 10 nanometers at a very short distance they're basically blind to
those defects and so here's you know cart a little cartoon these little blue
